faq.description: Quickly understand how to use the software and solve common issues

general.question: How do I start using this software?
general.answer: After installation, the software runs automatically in the system tray. You can right-click the tray icon to configure settings. By default, it saves workspace state every 5 minutes and supports auto-start on boot.

general.question: Is this software free?
general.answer: Yes, WorkspaceSaver is completely free for all users with no feature restrictions.

general.question: Will it affect my computer's performance?
general.answer: No. The software is optimized to use minimal resources only during saves, with negligible system impact during normal operation.

features.question: What types of windows are supported?
features.answer: We support all common application windows, such as documents, browsers, development tools, etc. You can also set which window types you don't want to save.

features.question: How do I restore my previous workspace?
features.answer: The software offers two restoration methods: 1. On system startup, it will automatically prompt you to choose windows to restore; 2. You can also right-click the system tray icon and select 'Restore Workspace' at any time.

features.question: Can I selectively restore specific windows?
features.answer: Yes. In the restore interface, you can freely choose which windows to restore, either by application category or individual windows.

features.question: Can I customize the save interval?
features.answer: Yes. In settings, you can adjust the auto-save interval, configure auto-start behavior, hotkeys, and other features.

technical.question: Which systems are supported?
technical.answer: Currently we support Windows 10 and above, including all Windows 11 versions.

technical.question: Where is the data stored?
technical.answer: All data is stored in a dedicated folder in your user directory, completely offline. You can backup or delete this data anytime.

technical.question: How do I get help if I have issues?
technical.answer: You can view the detailed user guide through the 'Help' option in the software, or report issues via Github Issues for prompt support.

posts.title: Effective Workspace Management Tips
posts.description: Explore how to optimize your multi-window workflow with WorkspaceSaver to boost productivity.
posts.content:
In today's digital work environment, we often need to handle multiple applications and windows simultaneously. How to effectively manage these windows and maintain a clean, efficient workspace has become an important topic.

## Common Workspace Management Issues

1. Window chaos leading to low productivity
2. Work progress loss due to unexpected shutdowns
3. Need to rearrange windows after restart
4. Complex window management in multi-monitor environments

## WorkspaceSaver Solutions

### 1. Auto Save Feature
- Regular saving of all window states
- Includes position, size, and layout information
- Prevents progress loss in unexpected situations

### 2. Smart Recovery System
- Automatic startup
- Selective restoration support
- Maintains workspace continuity

### 3. Personalized Configuration
- Custom save intervals
- Flexible startup options
- Window blacklist functionality

## Usage Tips

1. Set appropriate save intervals based on work nature
2. Use selective restore to manage different projects
3. Create personalized window layout templates
4. Regularly organize and optimize workspace layouts

## Summary

Through proper use of WorkspaceSaver, you can significantly improve work efficiency and reduce time spent on window management. Let's focus more on creation rather than repetitive window organization tasks.
